programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoor
programme.desc: Throughout the season we get a lot of footage that never makes it on the show and isn't enough for a whole episode, so we put it together here in Bits & Bites.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: As season 8 comes to a close, Ali and Rush reflect on some of the more memorable moments on the water. From the Florida Keys to San Diego, Guatemala, and the Bahamas, the show has taken us on quite the adventures with more to come!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: With the local Key West ship wrecks covered in Permit, Rush takes good friend and marine artist KC Scott fishing for "inspiration." While permit is the plan, the boys stay rigged and ready for the numerous species the Florida Keys may deliver when fishing offshore.

programme.title: Louisiana Catch and Cook
programme.desc: Join us at Pelican’s Roost in Delacroix, LA, where Captain Sean Thornton and Chef Jay Ducote were able to share the full Louisiana Catch & Cook experience with Texas Food Personality Trey “Chow Down” Chapman—with delicious results.

programme.title: Louisiana Catch and Cook
programme.desc: When most people visit the Big Easy they don’t recognize that they’re less than 45 minutes away from one of the best fishing spots in the country. In this episode, Jay Ducote will visit Delacroix Island where he will connect with Captain Nick Rando and be assigned the task of cooking EVERYTHING that’s caught during their day out on the water. As unpredictable fog rolls in, the morning starts off with a slow bite and the crew wonders if they’ll have anything to eat that night.

programme.title: Tidewater Diaries
programme.desc: Eric Bachnik leads & runs the most iconic hard bait brand in the saltwater tackle industry, Mirro-Lure. These legendary baits have a heritage that dates back to the 50's and owns the reputation as the only saltwater plug needed in an angler's tackle bag! Ask any serious speckled trout angler who makes the best hard bait and they'll always say, Mirro-Lure. We sit down with Eric and discover how it all got started as he reveals how these lures are made and designed by those who love to fish the "Salt".

programme.title: AFTCO Original Film
programme.desc: Bass fishing takes on numerous forms, from the simplicity of backyard pond fishing to the apex of competitive tournament angling. Yet, within this pursuit lies a distinct niche: trophy hunting via swimbait fishing. Unlike traditional baits, swimbaits stand out in their uniqueness within an angler's arsenal. Ranging from six to twelve-plus inches in length and weighing two to sixteen ounces, these baits require a quiver of specialized equipment and a different mindset. The adage "big bait, big fish" is the guiding principle, firmly centered on catching the biggest bass in the lake, armed with the largest baits from your tackle box.

programme.title: AFTCO Original Film
programme.desc: Panama is known for its world-class and virtually untouched fisheries. Isla Boca Brava is no exception. We assembled a dream team of anglers from all over the U.S. to test their specialized fishing techniques on the trip of a lifetime. Follow Mike Roy, Benny Ortiz, and Brandon Nelson as they head down to Tucan Lodge and meet up with Juan Spragge of Tucan Lodge Panama for a few days on the water they won’t soon forget.

programme.title: Working Class Hunter
programme.desc: Kristy goes on her first turkey hunt in Missouri. Thanks to her father’s shotgun and her brother guiding her, Kristy is able to walk away with not only the highest of emotions, and the hunger to continue her new hunting lifestyle, but she was able to provide a meal for her and her husband from field to table.

programme.title: Working Class Hunter
programme.desc: After open-heart surgery, Seth wasn’t sure if he could hunt again. But with determination and a crossbow, he proves anything is possible, taking down a big Ohio buck. See how heart, grit, and passion lead to an unforgettable harvest. Don’t miss Seth’s inspiring comeback!

programme.title: Working Class Hunter
programme.desc: Managing a healthy deer herd is part of being a responsible hunter. Stephen, Candice, and Cliff take on the challenge of herd management by focusing on does. It’s not just about the hunt—it’s about preserving the future. Join them on this important mission and see how it’s done.

programme.title: Working Class Hunter
programme.desc: Cliff’s hard work managing a farm with the landowner finally pays off with a big Kentucky whitetail in his sights. This hunt is more than just a trophy—it’s the result of years of dedication. See the hunt that proves patience pays off, and feel the rush of success yourself!

programme.title: Working Class Hunter
programme.desc: Nothing beats a hunting trip with friends. The Working Class Hunter team heads to Illinois to share laughs, build bonds, and of course, chase big whitetails. It’s more than just hunting—it’s about the memories made along the way. Watch this episode and feel like part of the team!

programme.title: Working Class Hunter
programme.desc: Hunting after loss is never easy, but Seth honors his late father by harvesting the last deer he passed on. This emotional hunt in Illinois is about more than a kill—it’s about family and legacy. Come along for the journey and see why this moment means everything.

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: Michael Pitts is joined by competition caller and call-maker Anthony Virga, as well as Cole Barthel. It's the first hunt of the year for the Realtree Road Trips crew.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Public competition, little sleep, mother nature, and a wrong turn. It's a rough weekend for the Arkansas opener but Dr. Duck and Billy Campbell wouldn't be anywhere else. It's the Super Bowl of Duck Hunting and everyone is ready to hit the timber.

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: Tyler Jordan is still hunting hard for the buck they call the "Wide 9". With the Georgia rut in full swing and bucks running everywhere the odds are getting better for Tyler to get a shot at him with his Hoyt bow. While Tyler hunts one end of Realtree Farms, land manger, Wes Doughtery is on the other end chasing a buck he has been after for quite some time. The rut in Georgia is in full swing and there is no better time than now to be in a tree stand.

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: Riley Green heads down to South Louisiana to finish out duck and deer season. The first morning duck hunt was absolutely epic with a 7 man limit at 7:35 am. Day 3 in the deer blind proved to be all Riley needed to close out his deer season with a big, wide 10 point!

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Dr. Duck gives a history lesson on hip hop and duck hunting in the Oklahoma Timber.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: The Black Cloud crew makes a quick trip to Northern Texas and hunt a small farm pond they've had success in in the past. As any duck hunter knows, duck hunts don't always go as planned!!

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: This week's episode takes place at the famed Honey Brake in Louisiana. Drake White kicks things off with a big 8-pointer, capping off an amazing comeback story for him. Riley Green continues his hot streak and takes a target buck. Finally, Tyler Jordan rounds out the incredible trip with his best buck ever. It's a giant typical.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Dr. Duck and Billy Campbell meet a new friend at the boat ramp. The group teams up in the timber. Then, an afternoon scouting trip pays off as the pair finds new water and new ducks.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Todd Jones jumps on Justin’s boat for a sight fishing dream day. After success along the beach, they turn to handlining for Goliath grouper and witness the amazing survival saga of the world’s luckiest fish.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Justin entices a friend to play hooky from work to set hooks offshore on a perfect “locals” day. The only thing better than the weather was the dinner they caught and cooked.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Witness a truly epic day on the water when Capt. Justin and Meredith find a secluded slice of beach teeming with redfish biting virtually everything. Topwater plugs, rusty flies and a live well full of bait make for an experience no redfish angler would forget

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: When your gut tells you to do something different than what’s in front of you, do you listen?Capt. Justin and Meredith listen, and find that success comes in many forms. And it turns out that success can be really tasty, too!

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: It’s opening day of grouper season and, for Capt. Justin Leake and one of his longtime fishing buddies, that means a trip offshore is in order. And what better way to break in a new boat than heading to some reefs and filling the cooler with one of the Gulf of Mexico’s most popular fish?

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: There’s nothing like a change in weather conditions to wreck a perfectly good fishing plan, and that’s exactly what Capt. Justin Leake and his cousin encounter when December turns unseasonably warm. It’s a grey morning with thick fog so Justin and Capt. Brent Berry won’t be heading offshore right away as planned. Instead, Justin turns to his Humminbird CoastMaster charts to pinpoint a near shore artificial reef just five minutes from the St. Andrews Pass, where the anglers will do a little fishing until the fog burns off. Capt. Leake opts to send a jig to the bottom and he’s not very picky about the one that gets tied on. “When fishing reefs, the specific jig doesn’t matter because it’s all about the presentation,” he says. “When you’re sitting on top of a wreck, break out the ‘junk jigs’ – they get bit just fine.” And that proves to be the case as Justin and Brent enjoy non-stop battles against amberjack, red snapper and bonita. And with a bite this good, there’s no reason to go anywhere else! Also, we take a look at the United States Coast Guard Auxiliary’s new paddle craft safety initiative.

programme.title: The Cast

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: After Dan Schmidt passes on a giant Six-Pointer in deer camp, notorious bowhunter Bob Robb capitalizes on the opportunity to check off "mature six-pointer" from his bucket list.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: With so much focus on Chronic Wasting Disease, a more deadly disease is all to often being overlooked while it decimates deer herds across the world, that disease is EHD.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Everybody is always fighting about does. Should you shoot them? Should you not? Well the teams explains why you're all probably right and wrong in this episode of Deer & Deer Hunting TV.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: It's lean, delicious, savory and the best part of the hunt. In this episode of Deer and Deer Hunting, Dan Schmidt, Mark Kayser and Brad Fenson share with us their thoughts on the other red meat, venison.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: There's nothing in the world like waking up and hitting the Sweet November woods. That said, make sure you're applying the right hunting tactics for the right time of year.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Hunting the late season is just as exciting as hunting during the rut. As a hunter you have the opportunity to better understand a whitetails needs now that winter has come. In this episode Mark Kayser attempts to fill his Iowa buck tag in December.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: Chef Jean-Paul Bourgeois and the crew are back at it for season 3 of duck camp dinners. With a historically dry year in Louisiana, the team dodges marsh fires, hunts alligators, and prepares for the opening day of teal season.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: Follow the DCD crew as they head North to hunt with duck call maker Brad Eldrige. Despite tough hunting conditions brought on by a historic drought in Louisiana, the crew is able to knock down a “Tensas Limit” of wood ducks, mallards, honkers, and squirrels.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: With the drought ending and rain headed their way, the crew hunts the final days of the first split in Bayou Black with new friends Jesse Griffiths and Dirk Sorrells.

programme.title: Beyond The Surface
programme.desc: Danny heads back to his hometown for the first time in his adult life hoping to make some quick connections with his salty roots.

programme.title: Beyond The Surface
programme.desc: Experience the thrill of fishing in the enchanting waters of the Everglades alongside the renowned Captain Danny Allen and Captain Leiza Fitzgerald. Embark on an unforgettable journey through the intricate maze of mangroves, expansive marshes, and shimmering backwaters, as these expert guides lead you to some of the most coveted fishing spots in the region.

programme.title: Beyond The Surface
programme.desc: Join Captain Danny Allen and Dan Benson from Power-Pole as they embark on an exciting fishing expedition in Cortez, Florida, in the latest installment of Beyond The Surface TV. Witness their relentless pursuit of fish as they adapt to the ever-changing conditions. Don't make the mistake of skipping this captivating episode – it's bound to leave you hooked!

programme.title: Beyond The Surface
programme.desc: Captain Danny Allen and Captain Bill Pitman are two seasoned fishermen who share an unyielding passion for the art of angling. Their extraordinary skills and deep love for the sea have led them to the breathtaking waters of Fernandina Beach , a hidden gem known for its abundant marine life and picturesque surroundings.

programme.title: Beyond The Surface
programme.desc: Prepare to embark on an awe-inspiring aquatic journey as "Legendary Pursuits: Conquering the Depths of Port Saint Joe" takes you on an epic fishing adventure like no other. Join us as we cast off into the pristine waters of Port Saint Joe, a coastal paradise brimming with marine treasures waiting to be discovered.

programme.title: Beyond The Surface
programme.desc: Dive into the exhilarating world of tarpon fishing in the historic city of St. Augustine, Florida. Join Capt. Danny as henavigates the timeless waters of the oldest city in Florida, seeking the mighty tarpon. These fish will test your angling skills and endurance.

programme.title: Primal Divide
programme.desc: With the Spring of 23’ Turkey Seasons still in full swing and tags still left to fill… I wanted to rerelease the “best of turkey season past”. The beginning clips shows the 2020 Single Season Archery Grand Slam in 38 Days! The second clips are my attempt to repeat in 2021!

programme.title: Primal Divide
programme.desc: Low turkey numbers and a few trespassers made this season tougher than normal. John hits a couple states in pursuit of a few gobblers, but ends up not punching his last tag for a reason that is not to common and often not discussed in conservation circles.

programme.title: Primal Divide
programme.desc: Never in a million years did I think I would be in Spain, much less hunting… An opportunity to chase true 100% Balerian Goats on the island of Mallorca presented itself after the 2023 season was already planned and set in motion. What do you? You make every effort to make it happen! Logistics, flight delays, and language barriers turned a 4 day hunt into 2. Witnessing their conservation efforts was definitely the highlight of the trip. Although different, it very much works for them and something others could learn from as we hunt to protect these species. Saddle up for a wild 2 days!

programme.title: Primal Divide
programme.desc: When Under Armour became the Title Sponsor of the Tactical Games, well…. I actually learned what the Tactical Games were. Kinda cross fit, kinda strong man all mixed with AR and pistol shooting. Ok, Sign me up!! But what did I just sign up for?! I was about to find out!

programme.title: Primal Divide
programme.desc: In this episode, John returns to Colorado and looks to connect with another archery velvet mule deer. With a great week of weather ahead, there should be plenty of stalk opportunities!

programme.title: Primal Divide
programme.desc: An unusually warm Iowa November led John to hunting clover food plots and a bit of deja vu. A buck John passed several times in 2022 would resurface on the same plot, and walk the same path as he did exactly 1 year prior to the day, only 30 mins off. Do you believe deer will repeat themselves? This episode might make you think so!!

programme.title: Primal Divide
programme.desc: Usually my summers are filled with trail cameras, food plots, and prepping for the whitetail season. This year I actually got ahead of the game and was able to carve out a week to go try some new hunting…. Bowfishing! I love to shoot bows and I love to fish, why not do them both at the same time?! It took awhile to get dialed in, but once I learned the refraction of the water & lights, thing heat up fast!

programme.title: Beyond The Surface
programme.desc: On this episode Capt. Danny joins his good buddy and talented marine artist, Stephen Ferrell. The two of them take the 27’ DekKat to fish some of Stephen’s favorite paddle-board spots here in Melbourne, Florida. Tune in and see what they can make happen on a challenging weather day seeking the elusive Snook!

programme.title: AFTCO Original Film
programme.desc: Bass fishing takes on numerous forms, from the simplicity of backyard pond fishing to the apex of competitive tournament angling. Yet, within this pursuit lies a distinct niche: trophy hunting via swimbait fishing. Unlike traditional baits, swimbaits stand out in their uniqueness within an angler's arsenal. Ranging from six to twelve-plus inches in length and weighing two to sixteen ounces, these baits require a quiver of specialized equipment and a different mindset. The adage "big bait, big fish" is the guiding principle, firmly centered on catching the biggest bass in the lake, armed with the largest baits from your tackle box.

programme.title: AFTCO Original Film
programme.desc: Panama is known for its world-class and virtually untouched fisheries. Isla Boca Brava is no exception. We assembled a dream team of anglers from all over the U.S. to test their specialized fishing techniques on the trip of a lifetime. Follow Mike Roy, Benny Ortiz, and Brandon Nelson as they head down to Tucan Lodge and meet up with Juan Spragge of Tucan Lodge Panama for a few days on the water they won’t soon forget.

programme.title: Working Class Hunter
programme.desc: Kristy goes on her first turkey hunt in Missouri. Thanks to her father’s shotgun and her brother guiding her, Kristy is able to walk away with not only the highest of emotions, and the hunger to continue her new hunting lifestyle, but she was able to provide a meal for her and her husband from field to table.

programme.title: Working Class Hunter
programme.desc: After open-heart surgery, Seth wasn’t sure if he could hunt again. But with determination and a crossbow, he proves anything is possible, taking down a big Ohio buck. See how heart, grit, and passion lead to an unforgettable harvest. Don’t miss Seth’s inspiring comeback!

programme.title: Working Class Hunter
programme.desc: Managing a healthy deer herd is part of being a responsible hunter. Stephen, Candice, and Cliff take on the challenge of herd management by focusing on does. It’s not just about the hunt—it’s about preserving the future. Join them on this important mission and see how it’s done.

programme.title: Working Class Hunter
programme.desc: Cliff’s hard work managing a farm with the landowner finally pays off with a big Kentucky whitetail in his sights. This hunt is more than just a trophy—it’s the result of years of dedication. See the hunt that proves patience pays off, and feel the rush of success yourself!

programme.title: Working Class Hunter
programme.desc: Nothing beats a hunting trip with friends. The Working Class Hunter team heads to Illinois to share laughs, build bonds, and of course, chase big whitetails. It’s more than just hunting—it’s about the memories made along the way. Watch this episode and feel like part of the team!

programme.title: Working Class Hunter
programme.desc: Hunting after loss is never easy, but Seth honors his late father by harvesting the last deer he passed on. This emotional hunt in Illinois is about more than a kill—it’s about family and legacy. Come along for the journey and see why this moment means everything.

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: Michael Pitts is joined by competition caller and call-maker Anthony Virga, as well as Cole Barthel. It's the first hunt of the year for the Realtree Road Trips crew.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Public competition, little sleep, mother nature, and a wrong turn. It's a rough weekend for the Arkansas opener but Dr. Duck and Billy Campbell wouldn't be anywhere else. It's the Super Bowl of Duck Hunting and everyone is ready to hit the timber.

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: Tyler Jordan is still hunting hard for the buck they call the "Wide 9". With the Georgia rut in full swing and bucks running everywhere the odds are getting better for Tyler to get a shot at him with his Hoyt bow. While Tyler hunts one end of Realtree Farms, land manger, Wes Doughtery is on the other end chasing a buck he has been after for quite some time. The rut in Georgia is in full swing and there is no better time than now to be in a tree stand.

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: Riley Green heads down to South Louisiana to finish out duck and deer season. The first morning duck hunt was absolutely epic with a 7 man limit at 7:35 am. Day 3 in the deer blind proved to be all Riley needed to close out his deer season with a big, wide 10 point!

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Dr. Duck gives a history lesson on hip hop and duck hunting in the Oklahoma Timber.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: The Black Cloud crew makes a quick trip to Northern Texas and hunt a small farm pond they've had success in in the past. As any duck hunter knows, duck hunts don't always go as planned!!

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: This week's episode takes place at the famed Honey Brake in Louisiana. Drake White kicks things off with a big 8-pointer, capping off an amazing comeback story for him. Riley Green continues his hot streak and takes a target buck. Finally, Tyler Jordan rounds out the incredible trip with his best buck ever. It's a giant typical.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Dr. Duck and Billy Campbell meet a new friend at the boat ramp. The group teams up in the timber. Then, an afternoon scouting trip pays off as the pair finds new water and new ducks.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Todd Jones jumps on Justin’s boat for a sight fishing dream day. After success along the beach, they turn to handlining for Goliath grouper and witness the amazing survival saga of the world’s luckiest fish.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Justin entices a friend to play hooky from work to set hooks offshore on a perfect “locals” day. The only thing better than the weather was the dinner they caught and cooked.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Witness a truly epic day on the water when Capt. Justin and Meredith find a secluded slice of beach teeming with redfish biting virtually everything. Topwater plugs, rusty flies and a live well full of bait make for an experience no redfish angler would forget

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: When your gut tells you to do something different than what’s in front of you, do you listen?Capt. Justin and Meredith listen, and find that success comes in many forms. And it turns out that success can be really tasty, too!

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: It’s opening day of grouper season and, for Capt. Justin Leake and one of his longtime fishing buddies, that means a trip offshore is in order. And what better way to break in a new boat than heading to some reefs and filling the cooler with one of the Gulf of Mexico’s most popular fish?

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: There’s nothing like a change in weather conditions to wreck a perfectly good fishing plan, and that’s exactly what Capt. Justin Leake and his cousin encounter when December turns unseasonably warm. It’s a grey morning with thick fog so Justin and Capt. Brent Berry won’t be heading offshore right away as planned. Instead, Justin turns to his Humminbird CoastMaster charts to pinpoint a near shore artificial reef just five minutes from the St. Andrews Pass, where the anglers will do a little fishing until the fog burns off. Capt. Leake opts to send a jig to the bottom and he’s not very picky about the one that gets tied on. “When fishing reefs, the specific jig doesn’t matter because it’s all about the presentation,” he says. “When you’re sitting on top of a wreck, break out the ‘junk jigs’ – they get bit just fine.” And that proves to be the case as Justin and Brent enjoy non-stop battles against amberjack, red snapper and bonita. And with a bite this good, there’s no reason to go anywhere else! Also, we take a look at the United States Coast Guard Auxiliary’s new paddle craft safety initiative.

programme.title: Primal Divide
programme.desc: With the Spring of 23’ Turkey Seasons still in full swing and tags still left to fill… I wanted to rerelease the “best of turkey season past”. The beginning clips shows the 2020 Single Season Archery Grand Slam in 38 Days! The second clips are my attempt to repeat in 2021!

programme.title: Primal Divide
programme.desc: Low turkey numbers and a few trespassers made this season tougher than normal. John hits a couple states in pursuit of a few gobblers, but ends up not punching his last tag for a reason that is not to common and often not discussed in conservation circles.

programme.title: Primal Divide
programme.desc: Never in a million years did I think I would be in Spain, much less hunting… An opportunity to chase true 100% Balerian Goats on the island of Mallorca presented itself after the 2023 season was already planned and set in motion. What do you? You make every effort to make it happen! Logistics, flight delays, and language barriers turned a 4 day hunt into 2. Witnessing their conservation efforts was definitely the highlight of the trip. Although different, it very much works for them and something others could learn from as we hunt to protect these species. Saddle up for a wild 2 days!

programme.title: Primal Divide
programme.desc: When Under Armour became the Title Sponsor of the Tactical Games, well…. I actually learned what the Tactical Games were. Kinda cross fit, kinda strong man all mixed with AR and pistol shooting. Ok, Sign me up!! But what did I just sign up for?! I was about to find out!

programme.title: Primal Divide
programme.desc: In this episode, John returns to Colorado and looks to connect with another archery velvet mule deer. With a great week of weather ahead, there should be plenty of stalk opportunities!

programme.title: Primal Divide
programme.desc: An unusually warm Iowa November led John to hunting clover food plots and a bit of deja vu. A buck John passed several times in 2022 would resurface on the same plot, and walk the same path as he did exactly 1 year prior to the day, only 30 mins off. Do you believe deer will repeat themselves? This episode might make you think so!!

programme.title: Primal Divide
programme.desc: Usually my summers are filled with trail cameras, food plots, and prepping for the whitetail season. This year I actually got ahead of the game and was able to carve out a week to go try some new hunting…. Bowfishing! I love to shoot bows and I love to fish, why not do them both at the same time?! It took awhile to get dialed in, but once I learned the refraction of the water & lights, thing heat up fast!

programme.desc: Based on a story by Rudyard Kipling.

programme.desc: When he arrives in the big city, lovable robot Johnny 5 encounters nefarious thugs who see his innocence as their high-tech ticket to easy street.

programme.title: The Next Karate Kid
programme.desc: A teenage girl struggles to balance the trials of high school, the discipline of martial arts, and the thrill of her first romance.

programme.title: Lost in Yonkers
programme.desc: A film adaptation of Neil Simon's Pulitzer Prize-winning comedy/drama that follows the escapades and tragedies of an unusual family in 1942 Yonkers.

programme.title: Vice Versa
programme.desc: An ill-gotten mystical skull has a body-and-mind-switching effect on a high-powered department store exec and his neglected 11-year-old son.

programme.title: Like Father, Like Son
programme.desc: A workaholic heart surgeon accidentally ingests a brain-transference serum, causing him to switch bodies with his laid-back teenage son.

programme.title: Relative Chaos
programme.desc: Dil and his girlfriend, Katherine, attempt to end his 25-year losing streak in the annual Gilbert Cup, a fiercely competitive family tradition.

programme.title: Bingo
programme.desc: A circus dog named Bingo becomes involved in a variety of adventures and misdemeanors, but that doesn't stop him from eventually making his way home!

programme.title: Slappy and the Stinkers
programme.desc: On a class trip to the aquarium, school kids rebel against their mean principal by stealing a sea lion that seems unhappy and trying to set it free.

programme.title: Miracle on the Mountain: The Kincaid Family Story
programme.desc: Based on a true story, this film recounts a family's struggle for survival after their private plane crashes on their way to a cabin in the mountains.

programme.title: Bermuda Triangle
programme.desc: A sudden storm leaves a family shipwrecked on an uncharted island inhabited by other stranded settlers and a tribe of natives with strange powers.

programme.title: Masterminds
programme.desc: A tech geek expelled from school for pulling pranks on staff becomes the one person with enough savvy to rescue students from a gang of kidnappers.

programme.title: Fast Getaway
programme.desc: A falling out within a bank robbing foursome splits up the group and pits a father and his 16-year-old son against their vengeful former partners.

programme.title: Short Circuit
programme.desc: When a lovable mechanical marvel of a robot is accidentally electrocuted, he flees his lab and lands on a young girl’s doorstep, ready for adventure

programme.title: You Can't Take It With You
programme.desc: Sweet-natured Alice Sycamore (Jean Arthur) falls for banker's son Tony Kirby (James Stewart). But when she invites her snooty prospective in-laws to dinner to give their blessing to the marriage, Alice's peculiar extended family -- including philosophical grandfather Martin Vanderhof (Lionel Barrymore), hapless fledgling ballerina sister Essie (Ann Miller) and fireworks enthusiast father, Paul (Samuel S. Hinds) -- might be too eccentric for the staid Kirbys.

programme.title: The Awful Truth
programme.desc: Jerry (Cary Grant) and Lucy (Irene Dunne) are a married couple who doubt each other's fidelity: Jerry suspects Lucy and her music teacher (Alexander D'Arcy) of spending an evening together, and Lucy is convinced Jerry lied about a business trip. When the jealous pair file for divorce, both rush into new relationships, but quickly realize their love never died. The soon-to-be-divorced husband and wife then both scramble to spoil each other's chances for newfound romance.

programme.title: Drive a Crooked Road
programme.desc: Auto mechanic Mickey must give up his dream of becoming a professional race car driver after he is fooled into being a chump for some gangsters.

programme.title: The Undercover Man
programme.desc: Determined Treasury Department investigator Frank Warren (Glenn Ford) goes after a ruthless mobster known as The Big Fellow. When a key informant is murdered, Warren pursues the gangster on charges of tax evasion. But, with a slick mob lawyer hampering him at every turn, and threats being lobbed toward Warren's wife (Nina Foch), the lawman's chances of achieving a conviction are slim to none. His only hope is that one syndicate bookkeeper will have the courage to turn state's evidence.

programme.title: The Goddess
programme.desc: As a child, she was Emily Ann, a poor girl in the South with no friends and an ineffective mother. But as an adult, she's Rita Shawn (Kim Stanley), an actress loved the world over. Still, all the money and fame in the world can't buy happiness, and Rita is plagued with depression over her broken relationships -- first to a handsome soldier (Steve Hill) and then to a boxing promoter (Lloyd Bridges) -- and her lack of any emotional connections to anyone outside of her professional life.

programme.title: Diamond Head
programme.desc: A wealthy Hawaiian pineapple plantation owner and bigoted bully with political ambitions flatly refuses to allow his young sister to marry a native.

programme.title: The Fuller Brush Man
programme.desc: Clumsy sanitation worker Red Jones (Red Skelton) is fired from his street-cleaning job shortly after his girlfriend, Ann Elliot (Janet Blair), refuses his marriage proposal until he betters himself. While training to become a door-to-door salesman, he accidentally stumbles into a murder investigation when the corrupt sanitation commissioner (Nicholas Joy) who had fired him is killed. When the murder weapon is found to be one of the brushes Red sells, he must fight to prove his innocence.

programme.title: Tell It to the Judge
programme.desc: Marsha Meredith (Rosalind Russell) has just been offered a position as a federal judge. Much to her dismay, her nomination is challenged on the grounds that her divorce renders her unsuitable for the courtroom. Desperate to win the position, Marsha arranges a fake marriage to Alexander (Gig Young), even though she still has feelings for Peter (Robert Cummings), her ex-husband. Marsha and Alexander -- and Marsha and Peter -- soon find themselves in a series of compromising situations.

programme.title: The Mating of Millie
programme.desc: A businesswoman (Evelyn Keyes) asks a bachelor (Glenn Ford) to help her find a husband so she can adopt an orphan.

programme.title: Sword of Sherwood Forest
programme.desc: After infiltrating a group of insurrectionists, Greene discovers their plan to murder the Archbishop of Canterbury and to take over Bawtry Castle.

programme.title: Born Yesterday
programme.desc: Brassy blonde moll Billie Dawn (Judy Holliday) hits Washington, D.C., with her unscrupulous millionaire sugar daddy, Harry Brock (Broderick Crawford), and his sleazy lawyer, Jim Devery (Howard St. John), who has been pressuring Harry to marry Billie by pointing out that a wife cannot be forced to testify against her husband. In an effort to make Billie more socially acceptable, Harry hires journalist Paul Verrall (William Holden) to smarten her up -- and sparks soon fly between the pair.

programme.title: The Mouse That Roared
programme.desc: When a kerfuffle over fine wine exports upends their tiny nation's economy, the prime minister and grand duchess of Fenwick declare war on the U.S.

programme.title: You Were Never Lovelier
programme.desc: Bob Davis (Fred Astaire), an American dancer in Buenos Aires, Argentina, finds himself desperate for work after losing all his money. He takes a gig at a wedding, hoping to impress the bride's father, Eduardo Acuña (Adolphe Menjou), a local club owner who has decreed that his daughters must marry in order of age. Eduardo eventually agrees to allow Bob to perform at his club, but only under the condition that he play suitor to his second-oldest daughter, the beautiful Maria (Rita Hayworth).

programme.title: Where Angels Go...Trouble Follows
programme.desc: A bus trip for the girls of St. Francis Academy in Pennsylvania takes a radical detour on its way to an interfaith youth rally in California.

programme.title: The Solid Gold Cadillac
programme.desc: A small stockholder-turned-corporate heroine ousts a crooked Board of Trustees and reinstates an honest director, falling in love along the way.

programme.title: Hamlet
programme.desc: The prince's quest for revenge becomes his undoing when his suspicion is confirmed that his uncle killed his father to win the throne and his mother.

programme.title: Sahara
programme.desc: A stranded group of six Allied soldiers trek across the desert, making their way to an abandoned fort, but are soon faced with a German battalion.

programme.title: A Dandy in Aspic
programme.desc: In this stylish spy thriller, a Londoner working in British Intelligence, Alexander Eberlin, turns out to be a Russian counter-espionage agent.

programme.title: A Night to Remember
programme.desc: In this suspenseful comedy, Nancy Troy (Loretta Young) and her mystery-author husband, Jeff (Brian Aherne), move into a dark basement apartment in New York City's Greenwich Village, in hopes of stirring up writing inspiration. When their neighbors begin acting oddly and one of them turns up dead, Nancy and Jeff must uncover a murder mystery in their own building, with a number of suspects lurking about, including the creepy Mrs. Devoe (Gale Sondergaard).

programme.title: Shopworn
programme.desc: After her release from a three-month prison sentence, Kitty Lane becomes an overnight musical sensation and renews her romance with David Livingston.

programme.title: Pal Joey
programme.desc: Charming musical featuring the love triangle between a lovable but mischievous man and the two women who could change his life, for love or money.

programme.title: The Whole Town's Talking
programme.desc: Clerk Arthur Jones (Edward G. Robinson) lives a dull life until someone realizes that he looks like gangster "Killer" Mannion (also Robinson). After Jones is brought in by the police and his identity is verified, he is given a note to assuage any other suspicious policeman. Jones is hired by a newspaper to write about Mannion and starts dating Wilhelmina Clark (Jean Arthur). However, when Jones returns home one night, Mannion is waiting and demands the note so that he can roam freely.

programme.title: The Taming of the Shrew
programme.desc: A rich merchant's beautiful daughter and her volatile older sister are courted by rival suitors in this rambunctious version of Shakespeare's comedy.

programme.title: Hot Blood
programme.desc: A gypsy woman who lives by decamping with marriage settlements from wealthy men meets her match in the handsome younger brother of a gypsy king.

programme.title: Oklahoma Crude
programme.desc: An oil derrick owner in early 1900s Oklahoma, along with her father and a bum, tries her best to keep oil companies from buying her estate.

programme.title: Legend of the Golden Gun
programme.desc: After his family is killed, a quiet, young farmer turns into a deadly gunfighter, dedicating his life to the pursuit of evildoers.

programme.title: The Stranger Wore a Gun
programme.desc: After the Civil War, a spy for the Confederacy absconds to Arizona to start a new life but gets reluctantly pulled into a stagecoach gold robbery.

programme.title: Riders of the Northwest Mounted
programme.desc: A Mountie (Russell Hayden) and his partner (Dub Taylor) set out on a manhunt.

programme.title: Gunmen From Laredo
programme.desc: A framed Texas rancher (Robert Knapp) escapes from prison for a showdown with a saloonkeeper (Walter Coy).

programme.title: The Violent Men
programme.desc: Former Union soldier John Parrish (Glenn Ford) wants to sell his ranch and start a new life by settling down out east. However, the ruthless tactics of Lew Wilkison (Edward G. Robinson), the scheming businessman interested in his property, make Parrish reconsider the move, especially after one of his ranch hands is murdered. Adding to the increasingly tense conflict is Wilkison's wife, Martha (Barbara Stanwyck), who is cheating on her husband with his brother, Cole (Brian Keith).

programme.title: The Guns of Fort Petticoat
programme.desc: Texan and U.S. Cavalryman Lt. Frank Hewitt (Audie Murphy) deserts the army after Colorado Union soldiers carry out the deadly Sand Creek reservation massacre, fearing reprisal from the Cheyenne. Crossing into Texas, Franks finds himself labeled a traitor for fighting with the Yankees, and his warnings about possible Indian revenge go unheeded. When a town near a mission, populated mostly by women, is attacked, Frank is appointed their protector and must build an army comprised of townswomen.

programme.title: Return of the Durango Kid
programme.desc: A stagecoach passenger poses as a masked avenger to track down the thieves who robbed him and his companions.

programme.title: Up the MacGregors
programme.desc: Gregor MacGregor (David Bailey) is celebrating his upcoming marriage to Rosita Carson (Agata Flori) when bandits, led by the evil Maldonado (Leo Anchóriz), steal the family fortune. Determined to get their money back, Gregor and his six brothers go after the robbers. They run across a dentist and his beautiful daughter, who help them find the gang's hideout and retrieve their cash -- but then Maldonado takes Rosita hostage in retaliation. When Gregor comes to save her, he is also captured.

programme.title: The Nevadan
programme.desc: After fleeing a sheriff's escort to jail, an outlaw thief crosses paths with a mysterious stranger and a greedy rancher en route to his stash of gold.

programme.title: Arizona Raiders
programme.desc: Two ex-Quantrill's raiders (Audie Murphy, Ben Cooper) join the Arizona Rangers to hunt raiders still at large.

programme.title: Hands Across the Rockies

programme.title: Cowboy

programme.title: The Quick Gun
programme.desc: A banished gunfighter (Audie Murphy) returns to his sweetheart (Merry Anders) and helps his sheriff friend (James Best) face outlaws.

programme.title: The Untamed Breed
programme.desc: Texas ranchers resist an out-of-towner (Sonny Tufts) who has a Brahman bull to breed.

programme.title: The Professionals
programme.desc: Four soldiers of fortune are hired by a wealthy rancher to rescue his beautiful young wife who has been kidnapped by a villainous Mexican bandit. When they finally find her, after fighting their way across deserts and mountains, they discover she is not being held against her will. This causes friction within the band as to whether they should honor their agreement.

programme.title: Jack McCall, Desperado
programme.desc: A lone gunslinger, Jack McCall (George Montgomery), bursts into a saloon and shoots dead the legendary Wild Bill Hickok (Douglas Kennedy). Arrested and put on trial, McCall recounts a twisted tale that paints Hickok as anything but heroic, explaining how Hickok and McCall's cousin Bat (James Seay) took over McCall's family's plantation, killed his parents and even framed him for crimes he didn't commit. McCall's cold-blooded killing of Hickok was warranted. Or was it?

programme.title: Land Raiders
programme.desc: An Arizona land-grabber (Telly Savalas) and his brother (George Maharis) renew their feud amid Army troops and Apaches.

programme.title: The Doolins of Oklahoma
programme.desc: Old West outlaw Bill Doolin (Randolph Scott) marries a deacon's wife, but his gang will not leave him alone.

programme.title: J.W. Coop
programme.desc: After spending a decade behind bars for writing bad checks and punching a cop, former rodeo star J.W. Coop (Cliff Robertson) re-enters a world drastically different from how he left it; the only constant seems to be his mother (Geraldine Page). Gradually coming to terms with societal changes and cultural norms, Coop is determined to climb back to the top spot on the rodeo circuit. Along the way, he hooks up with Bean (Cristina Ferrare), a liberated woman who helps him catch up to modern life.

programme.title: Coroner Creek
programme.desc: A gunfighter (Randolph Scott) loses his beloved in a robbery and hunts the man (George Macready) to blame, who is living off the loot.

programme.title: The Desperadoes
programme.desc: Sheriff Steve Upton (Randolph Scott) is a devoted lawman who works tirelessly to keep order in his small town, nestled within the Utah territory. So, when Cheyenne Rogers (Glenn Ford), an old friend with a criminal past, rolls into town, Upton is immediately on edge. Cheyenne assures his pal that all that's behind him now. But when the town bank is robbed, Cheyenne becomes the locals' number one suspect. He'll have to prove his innocence to save himself and his friend's reputation.

programme.title: Alvarez Kelly
programme.desc: Alvarez Kelly (William Holden) is a Mexican cattle rancher who is doing his best to stay out of the Civil War. He has no interest in which side may win or lose -- Kelly is far more concerned about his own survival, and about making money. He soon finds himself in the middle of the conflict, however, when a confederate colonel (Richard Widmark) captures the rancher and forces Kelly to help his soldiers steal a nearby herd of cattle, which they desperately need for food.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Peter and Caroline Cave are house-hunting in Midsomer Newton. Shortly before leaving their hotel they mention they haven't been able to find what they're looking for; "something old and derelict that they can do up." Anne Merrick tells them about Winyard, a tumbledown cottage in the woods, might be for sale. At the estate agents they are told the house is not yet available for viewing. Later that evening they find the house on their own. However, Caroline has read up on the cottage's haunted reputation and only reluctantly explores it with Peter. The next morning they are found strangled in their own car. DCI Barnaby starts the investigation with the help of PC Ben Jones and they come across the world of estate agents, identical twins, ghosts, piano wire, and more before another body turns up.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A newly discovered masterpiece by landscape artist Henry Hogson causes a stir when it is auctioned for £400,000 - just hours before its former owner is tortured and killed. When another Hogson is stolen, Barnaby decides to become an expert on the Midsomer painter, with the help of art teacher Matilda Simms (Susannah Harker). He soon realises the paintings are not what they seem - but the death toll is rising.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Former secret agent Geoffrey Larkin arrives in Midsomer Parva and stays at Allenby House, a country mansion run by former spies Sir Malcolm Frazer (Benjamin Whitrow), his son Nicky (Peter Davison) and Nicky's wife Jenny (Alice Krige) as a safe house. Geoffrey is soon gashed to death after a cricket match in Midsomer Parva, and the locals blame the 'beast of Midsomer'. However, Barnaby - a former spy himself - soon realises that the killing has links to Allenby House and Cold War Berlin, but is initially thrown off the case by MI6. But when a further murder occurs MI6 Agent Glen Jarvis (Neil Stuke) asks Barnaby back on the case.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Midsomer University science fellow and cycling enthusiast George Jeffers (David Haig) threatens to make public a problem with his state-of-the-art invention Kernel Logic, but American software boss Clinton Finn fears he will lose millions if the truth comes out. When a schoolteacher is killed in a hit-and-run, Barnaby suspects Jeffers was the intended target. The subsequent murder of a fellow cyclist (Philip Jackson) brings the involvement of fellow University associates (Jonathan Cecil and Jim Norton) into sharper focus.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: In the peaceful village of Little Worthy, Bob Moss was about to open up his beloved model village, when he found a gruesome extra attraction. Young local, Richard Tanner, had been stabbed in the side and his corpse tied down like Gulliver in Lilliput. Barnaby and Jones wonder who wanted him dead, but when the woman he was secretly meeting is killed during the village's Crazy Craft race, the pair have to delve in and discover who might be lying and hiding secrets.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A cat burglar is on the loose, one known as "the Creeper", but the wave of burglaries he or she have committed, seem to have finally led to murder, when David Roper (Rik Mayall) is found smothered in his bed on the Chettham family estate. Yet Barnaby and Jones learn he may have been planning to write a book that could have been quite uncomfortable for someone, leading the pair to determine whether members of the Chettham family, or their friends, were responsible.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A sleep-walking school teacher (Nancy Carroll) starts to believe she has slit the throats of her mentor (Tim Wylton) and a local handyman man in her sleep, but her friends (Paola Dionisotti and Monica Dolan) are not convinced that she is the culprit, nor is Barnaby. A local philanthropist (Paul Chapman) and his social-climbing wife (Suzanne Burden) are planning the annual Frobisher night - but will it go without a hitch, and can they identify the killer?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A disused airfield near Morton Fendle is the location for a romantic evening between young Simon Bright and his girlfriend Laura Sharp - absolutely nothing could ruin their date. The next morning, when Frances Kirby is out for her morning jog, she notices the vintage car they were in up at the airfield, containing Simon Bright's dead body, with Laura nowhere to be seen. Confused, Detective Chief Inspector Barnaby and D.S. Jones can't work out whether it was a suicide pact or murder. Furthermore, they've got to find Miss Sharp and their investigation leads them to linking Simon and Laura with the villagers of Morton Fendle, who met at Elaine Trim's dancing classes. Eventually, the Barnaby family plus Jones make it to a 40s style dance night at the village hall before more villagers start turning up dead.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When Faith Alexander arrives in Midsomer County to meet her long-lost uncle Rex Masters, she gets a shock - Rex's staff had been told that she was dead. Things become even more complex when Rex's body is found in a nearby river, bearing wounds that suggest he was murdered. Barnaby and Jones are soon on the case, trying to establish who would have wanted the elderly man dead. Several people soon come forward with multiple wills, which confuse the matter, but when two more people, close friends of Rex, are also murdered, the investigation raises question on the motive, leading Barnaby to wonder if it was down to finances, passion, or something from Rex's past.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Following the death of Alan King while on a business trip to China, the family company, King's Crystal, is in financial trouble. As plans to shut the Midsomer Magna factory are being put into action, Alan's wife Hilary and brother Charles are married in the village church - much to the dismay of Alan's son Ian. In addition to strife between members of the family, the factory workers are outraged at the loss of their jobs. So when company accountant Peter Baxter is found murdered, Barnaby and Jones suspect a disgruntled employee is to blame. But in order to investigate the matter further, Jones is forced to work undercover, and infiltrate the local group of Freemasons in the village.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The music lovers of Midsomer County are delighted when a host of bands arrives for the Midsomer Rocks festival. Barnaby himself is particularly looking forward to seeing recently re-formed rock band, Hired Gun, perform on stage, but he soon gets close to the band for rather unfortunate reasons. During their opening performance, the band's singer, Mimi (Suzi Quatro), falls to the ground dead - electrocuted by a wire that had been run through the microphone stand. Barnaby and Jones soon find the rest of the band could be targets, and when another is killed, questions are raised as to whether former band member, Ginger Foxton, who went missing for 30 years and is presumed dead, is still at large. The detectives soon have to delve into a world of rock music, drug use and greed, to find the truth.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The suspicious death of popular young GP Dr Alan Delaney brings Barnaby and Jones to Midsomer Market to investigate. The detectives are baffled as to a motive for murder - until they consider that the newly engaged Dr James Kirkwood may have been the intended victim. Before long, Barnaby and Jones are heading to Wales - former home to Delyth Mostyn, James's fiancee, to delve deeper into the mystery. There are certainly possible suspects in the murder and attempt on Kirkwood, from Delyth's children, who oppose the engagement, Delyth's husband, and more, as the detectives investigate things, in hopes of uncovering the truth before a major walk is to take place on Mount Snowdon.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: In the build-up to Luxton Deeping's annual photographic exhibition, a battle rages between the traditional and digital photographers of the pretty village. The dispute seems harmless enough - until Lionel Bell is found murdered in a nearby woodland, strangled with the cord of his light meter. Barnaby soon gets to work tracking down the killer, but it seems someone is trying to implicate the detective in the murder. And once he is replaced on the case, finding the culprit seems less likely than ever, as his replacement is more concerned of an upcoming wedding than the investigation. Barnaby is forced to work off the case to uncover who is framing him, and who wants dead other photographers in the village.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The residents of Midsomer Magna are thrilled when a production crew arrives at the local manor house to film a version of The Scarlet Pimpernel. But the crew members aren't the only visitors to the area - Jones has spotted notorious criminal George Ince nearby. But when the director, Nick Cheney, is found dead - his head severed by a prop guillotine - Barnaby must discover who would have wanted the victim dead. It soon becomes clear that things are not so simple, and the detectives soon have to shift through varying motives, layered by lies, hidden truths, and a possible robbery to be committed.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby is in Midsomer Holm, bidding farewell to reformed criminal Ronnie Tyler, who has taken part in a rehabilitation scheme in the village. Also present is disgraced ex-policeman Jack Colby, a former colleague of Barnaby's – but Jack refuses to talk to his old friend. When Jack is murdered, the detective must delve into the dark secrets in the victim's past. There are certainly dark secrets to uncover, and Barnaby has to determine whether the victim's part in a scandal years earlier at Causton police station, is key to the mystery behind his death. It isn't long before he finds that Eddie Marston is attempting blackmail, and soon murdered as a result, and that Lord Holm is in love with Jack's wife, psychotherapist Gina.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The appearance of a headless horseman at Quitewell Hall foreshadows a number of deaths amongst an aristocratic family. In the midst of a Civil War re-enactment the family relive their own historic battles with their hostile neighbours. But what is the truth about the DeQuettevilles - and the ghostly rider?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a barrister is killed in Midsomer, suspicion falls on convicted murderer Grady Felton. Grady has just returned to the village where he committed the murder years ago amid much anger from locals. But Grady has a solid alibi. Barnaby suspects he is working with an accomplice - until Grady himself is targeted in an arson attack.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The murder of a journalist has chilling echoes of a 1960s horror film starring Midsomer's own Stella Harris. When Stella's more famous sister returns after a 40-year family rift, the killings escalate, each of them reminiscent of a movie plot. Is life - and death - imitating art?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: As darkness covers Midsomer Stanton during a total eclipse of the sun, amateur astronomer Jeremy Harper is killed by a blow to the head with a meteorite. Barnaby and Jones soon discover intrigue, sexual tension and academic rivalry are rife among the star-seeking community.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Harriet Farmer wakes up after being in a coma since the night she tried to elope. Soon afterwards, a killer strikes members of a chess club. Could the attack which left Harriet for dead a year ago be linked to moves on a chess board? And where is her boyfriend Finn?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A woman is crushed to death with a giant round of cheese at the home of the world-famous Midsomer Blue. Secret and controversial plans to modernise the dairy are revealed while rumours about private lives of the parents cause a row at the prestigious local prep school. As other people linked to the dairy meet agonising deaths, long-held secrets start to emerge...

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The residents of Milton Cross, a feudal estate with a church, farms, houses and acres of land, depend on lord of the manor Edward Milton for their livelihoods. But when Sonia Woodley is stabbed in the churchyard two years after the death of her abusive husband Gerald, Barnaby and Jones investigate, trying to work out who killed her. It soon becomes clear someone took a pair of tailor scissors to do the deed, but who amongst the villagers could have done so, is unclear, and the investigation is complicated, when the pair learn the local Anglican priest, the parish vicar, had received a letter from Sonia. When he himself is killed, the pair believe something in the letter may be key to solving the mystery.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby is not convinced about Mayor David Hicks' plans to revive an annual trip to Brighton, suspecting his proposal to buy coastal land there, is rather a fraudulent scheme. Naturally, he joins the trip, but during their time in Brighton, a hated property developer (Tim McInnerny) is beheaded on a ghost house ride, prompting Barnaby to team up with his cousin to determine whether the developer's renters, the mayor, a gloomy reverend (Mark Gatiss), or the lady of a large estate are responsible, and soon discovers a hotbed of jealously, debt, lies and more, conceal a far darker secret.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Ford Florey is a town with a Wild West Society and many grudges. During a Wild West show at the local faire, the witch on the 'Dunk the Witch' stall is well and truly dunked but laughter soon turns to horror when she doesn't get up and the water in the tank starts to turn red. Barnaby and Jones need to be quick on the draw to track down the murderer, and soon begin to wonder whether a dispute over land was the motive, or something far more sinister, especially when more people are killed, with methods linked to the Wild West.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: On a dark night in the village of March Magna, Barnaby's wife Joyce swerves her car and narrowly misses a shadowy figure in the road - or so she thinks, when later that night a body is discovered in the old cemetery. The victim was a member of the council who was strange and weird, but someone seemed to have quite a grudge on him, and so Barnaby and Jones delve into his background, and the village, attempting to determine who might have wanted him dead, finding ghosts, grudges, and more beneath the village's surface.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Piano student Zoe Stock has won a place at the Devington Manor Winter School led by internationally renowned musician, Sir Michael Fielding (James Fox). Yet when she is there, things become mysterious when from the river bank in the grounds of the manor she sees a woman jump from the bridge and disappear underwater. When Barnaby and Jones start investigating the possible drowning, they discover unsavoury connections to the past that could prove lethal 20 years later, especially when someone attempts to kill. It isn't long, before murder does occur, and the detectives attempt to fathom what occurred in the drowning, and the present day murders.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When Midsomer Morchard's very own boxer, John Kinsella, wins a world title in New York, the success seems to be a joyous time for all, until murder rears its ugly head. When a local solicitor is found dead by his assistant and Kinsella's manager, Barnaby attempts to determine what is going on, and soon discover issues with inheritance, affairs, anger, and gambling to make matters difficult. Meanwhile Kinsella's trainer Teddy Molloy (Phil Daniels) has his own hidden agenda. When a re-enactment of a Victorian boxing match gets heated, and Kinsella's manager is found dead in his home's gym, the pair attempt to determine who is responsible, although Barnaby's judgement seems to be clouded on this one.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A planning dispute turns to murder, after a leading light in the Midsomer Conservation Society suspects her neighbours are involved in a money-making development scam. Political wrangling, burglaries and sexual liaisons abound in picturesque Great Pelfe - but when a member of the possible scam is themselves murdered, Barnaby wonders what is truly going on behind the scenes of an important by-election.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny and the team continue wrestling with a stock restoration Mustang mess, hoping for extra funds and a lot of patience from their client; Kevin spots a rare old Grand Prix and Danny visits a world class specialist, looking for ideas.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny and the team are commissioned to restore a 1941 Triumph motorcycle back to its WWII era glory. Even with a $50K budget, the project turns into one of the biggest challenges.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny and his crew continue to piece together a WWII era Triumph motorcycle for a client hoping to have it as a tribute to his family's military roots.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: A high end client has his heart set on a tricked out '68 Camaro, so Danny sets out to find one and give it the world class Counts Kustoms treatment.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Shannon recruits the guys to help him finish up a gift for Danny, a bike he started building for him- ten years ago. Meanwhile, Danny spots a 1969 Corvette in a friend's lot.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny charges Ryan with customizing a brand new Chevy Silverado for their most difficult customer--himself!

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny and the team are commissioned to build a bike for a true American hero, a military veteran.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: Some of the most unique and sought-after vehicles make their way across the Barrett-Jackson auction block including a special Hendricks edition Camaro whose massive sale supports a great cause.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: As the crew says goodbye for now to Houston, Texas, the World's Greatest Collector Car Auction continues to excite; someone could take home the famous Love Bug Beetle or the one-of-a-kind Ford GT.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: The World's Greatest Collector Car Auctions return to Scottsdale, Ariz., with an incredible lineup of classics, trucks, customs, and celebrity-owned vehicles selling at no reserve.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: It's between Shelby and Ford to see who will cross the million-dollar mark first as the World's Greatest Collector Car Auctions continues in Scottsdale, Arizona!

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: Another million-dollar vehicle is sold when some of the greatest customs, classics, trucks and supercars cross the auction block at no reserve in Scottsdale, Ariz.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: Chevys and Fords strive to break past six figures on the auction block as various vehicles sell for no reserve at the World's Greatest Collector Car Auctions in Scottsdale, Ariz.

programme.desc: Fords, Chevys, Land Rovers, and more take center stage as vehicles of all sizes and shapes shine for the buyers bidding big bucks in Scottsdale, Ariz.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: It's Ford versus Ferrari and Corvettes versus Chevelles as the World's Greatest Collector Car Auctions continue to break records selling incredible vehicles in beautiful Scottsdale, Ariz.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: The bidding is fast and furious as celebrity vehicles cross the auction block; JFK, Rod Stewart, and Gen. Colin Powell are just some of the owners of cars selling at no reserve.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: It's Lamborghini versus everyone in Scottsdale, Ariz.; The World's Greatest Collector Car Auctions once again feature some of the most scintillating vehicles ever sold, including a Lamborghini Diablo owned by Danny Koker.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: Fords, Pontiacs, Chevys, and Porsches go head to head as bidders go dollar for dollar trying to get the best deals on the finest vehicles in sunny Scottsdale, Ariz.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: Roadsters, Superbirds, and Porsche 911s are the main attraction, but a Fast Attack Buggy from "Fast & Furious 7," a replica John Deere Tractor, a Little Gem Travel Trailer, and a Divco Custom Milk Truck are also sure to turn heads.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: Among a bevy of beautiful vehicles being auctioned at no reserve are Simon Cowell's 1970 Triumph Spitfire MK III Convertible and John Mayer's 2006 Ford GT Heritage Edition!

programme.desc: Some loggers have more reasons to be grateful than do others as Thanksgiving arrives; the Pihl crew loses men to illness; the Gustafson crew's younger members blow off steam; the season's first snowfall bodes a warning for the Stump Branch crew.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The Gustafson crew faces a nearly impossible deadline; half the Pihl crew skips work; Stump Branch mistakes and inexperience put profits and lives at risk; Jay Browning makes a troubling discovery about his next job.

programme.desc: The worst storm in 25 years pummels the Oregon coast, turning the town of Veronica into a flooded disaster area; Jay Browning is nowhere to be found; Darrell must act fast to save his house from falling trees.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Shelby Stanga continues his search for the million-dollar log raft; the Dreadknots have a new deckhand and a new enemy; Gabe Rygaard defends his title with a whole new crew and without his dad; the boys of Papac are back.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Shelby goes diving in gator infested waters; Rygaard and Oakes square off on a way road; the Dreadknots go their separate ways; fire breaks out on the mountain.

programme.desc: A chainsaw accident leaves the crew short-handed; Jason flips a loaded trailer; Shelby finds out if he filled his board foot order.

programme.title: Ax Men

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers look for south-of-the-border treasure in San Diego; Rene and Casey defend their home turf against Darrell and Brandon; Mary eyes a high-end household unit; Ivy brings two extra Calvins to the festivities.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers dig deep for bargains in the desert country of Mojave, Calif.; Dave works hard despite his dislike of the territory; Ivy hunts for fun off-road finds.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Barry Weiss and his cohort, Kenny, share behind-the scenes moments and commentary from favorite episodes of the series.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Barry Weiss and his cohort, Kenny, share behind-the scenes moments and commentary from favorite episodes of the series.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: A visit to Torrance, Calif., yields only a few quality units; Jarrod purchases a locker that forces Brandi to face her fears; Ivy tries a new approach; Rene gives two new buyers the business.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers head to the desert resort city of Palm Springs, Calif.; Mary attempts to stay within her budget while Darrell loosens the purse strings; Ivy has difficulty focusing on the task at hand.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Barry Weiss and his cohort, Kenny, share behind-the scenes moments and commentary from favorite episodes of the series.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers battle for the best unit available in Torrance, Calif.; Ivy finds success when he changes tactics; Brandi puts Jarrod on a budget.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: An auction in Bellflower, Calif., includes big-money finds; Ivy scours through a bad buy for anything of value; Jarrod purchases a unit that forces Brandi to face her fears.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Dan and Laura take the buyers on a wild ride through the Inland Empire; Ivy gets an eyeful; Mary hopes to land treasure by purchasing early.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Dave gets in touch with his lighter side as the buyers visit Fontana, Calif.; Mary tries to add a touch of Texas to the festivities; Jarrod and Brandi attempt to recover from a bad purchase.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Jarrod has difficulty finding his groove in Riverside, Calif.; an item stumps Dave; Ivy tries a new strategy; Mary discovers the romantic side of purchasing lockers.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Ivy changes his game and pursues a locker with collectibles; Mary looks for quick-sale items; Darrell calls upon a friend for assistance when he is tested by local Mission Hills buyers.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: It's all hands on deck for the Duckmen when an old high school nemesis challenges them to a good old fashion race... at the local lawn mower competition. But Willie and the guys soon find out that this sport is nothing short of high octane.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: With Sadie's (Willie's daughter) driver's license test fast approaching, she finds herself in dire need of lessons.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After Willie's son (John Luke) leaves Willie's pickup in the driveway with a bone-dry gas tank, Willie and Korie decide that it's time to get the kid his own car.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The Duck Commander assembly room gets an unexpected shakeup when a disgruntled Si decides to quit his job. But when Willie hires a replacement that clashes with the duck call room, Jase and the guys quickly become equally miserable at work. Meanwhile, Si turns to Phil for work out on the land turning a routine levee repair into a complete disaster.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie finds his office in shambles and alerts the authorities that the warehouse has had a break in. But soon Willie discovers that the culprit was his brother Jase, who needed supplies for an early morning frog hunt.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When a heat wave envelops West Monroe the air conditioning unit at the Duck Commander warehouse goes down, turning the duck call assembly room into a boiling sweatshop.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After Korie decides the junk piles in the Duck Commander warehouse are beginning to reach critical mass, she calls on Willie and the guys to do a little company spring-cleaning. But the discovery of an old Ping-Pong table deep within the clutter quickly turns the chore into an all day table tennis tournament. Meanwhile, Uncle Si realizes that he's many years overdue for an appointment with the local eye doctor and ventures out for some new glasses.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After attending a local radio show as a guest, Willie sees an opportunity to host a show of his own. When the station gives him the opportunity, Willie makes the mistake of bringing Uncle Si on the air with him.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: While out duck hunting, Willie, Jase, and Uncle Si stumble across what redneck's consider nature's most prized succulent treasure--a beehive dripping with wild honey.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Willie finds out that his daughter Sadie has a new boyfriend, he wants to get to know him, while instilling some fatherly fear--Robertson style.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie decides to expand the Duck Commander brand into the winemaking industry and buys a vineyard...sight unseen.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jase volunteers to take the Duck Commander RV out on pick up, but neglects to mention to Willie, he's taking Si, Martin and Jep along for a road trip.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jase and Si embark on a turkey hunt for the annual Robertson men vs. Robertson women cook-off to create a feast of fresh wild game. With Phil's discerning palate as judge, the teams pull out all of the stops.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When a big business decision must be made affecting Duck Commander, Willie plans an employee retreat.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: It's all hands on deck for the Duckmen when an old high school nemesis challenges them to a good old fashion race... at the local lawn mower competition. But Willie and the guys soon find out that this sport is nothing short of high octane.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: With Sadie's (Willie's daughter) driver's license test fast approaching, she finds herself in dire need of lessons.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After Willie's son (John Luke) leaves Willie's pickup in the driveway with a bone-dry gas tank, Willie and Korie decide that it's time to get the kid his own car.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When a heat wave envelops West Monroe the air conditioning unit at the Duck Commander warehouse goes down, turning the duck call assembly room into a boiling sweatshop.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After Korie decides the junk piles in the Duck Commander warehouse are beginning to reach critical mass, she calls on Willie and the guys to do a little company spring-cleaning. But the discovery of an old Ping-Pong table deep within the clutter quickly turns the chore into an all day table tennis tournament. Meanwhile, Uncle Si realizes that he's many years overdue for an appointment with the local eye doctor and ventures out for some new glasses.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After attending a local radio show as a guest, Willie sees an opportunity to host a show of his own. When the station gives him the opportunity, Willie makes the mistake of bringing Uncle Si on the air with him.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The Jase, Si and the guys from the duck call room take a field trip to a brand new local donut shop and quickly find out who amongst them can eat the most delicious treats.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie receives a special gift from a Japanese business associate - a "priceless" samurai sword, which Willie keeps out of the hands of Jase and the guys.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie pushes his work force too far after implementing new "motivational work tactics," and the guys rise up against him and go on strike.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When NASCAR sensation Clint Bowyer pays a visit to the Duck Commander warehouse, Willie and the guys are fired up to spend the day hanging out with the professional racecar driver. But too much enthusiasm about the celebrity's mode of transportation turns into a drag race showdown between Willie and Clint. Phil and Si have their hands full fixing Ms. Kay's barbecue when a trip to the outdoor grill store turns disastrous.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: It's Willie's turn to play Santa Claus at the local church this year but Uncle Si crashes the party and the event goes south in a hurry. Meanwhile, the family gathers at Phil and Miss Kay's house to celebrate the holidays in true redneck fashion.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Tomorrow is the opening day of Duck Season and the men are carrying on their tradition of camping on the Robertson Land the night before... including Willie.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Gearing up for his high school reunion, Willie realizes that he could stand to lose a few pounds. Jase and Korie set out to help him drop some weight and the strenuous battle of man-versus-waistline begins.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The guys learn from Willie that John Luke is going through his first break up. In order to make him feel better the men decide to take John Luke hunting for nutria, and impart their relationship wisdom.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When the warehouse guys new office pet (a lizard) escapes, they try all they can in order to catch the wily reptile. Proving impossible, the guys finally decide to bring in the big guns to help trap it--Mr. Phil Robertson.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: With Willie out-of-town, the guys decide to flake off work and leave to brush up the duck blinds on the Robertson land. While out, Si believes he spots what he thinks is the infamous "Black Panther,"

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie and Jase invite Korie and Missy along on a deer hunt because they believe their wives have become too "city."

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: During Duck Commander's "Casino Night" party for the sale of their 5 millionth duck call, Si Robertson wins the grand prize of $2000 and decides to buy a massage chair for the duck call room.

programme.desc: A compilation of the best scenes from all 11 seasons of A&E's hit series Duck Dynasty.
